intro: Senecio willingii, commonly known as the Cape Hottentot, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Senecio willingii produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
